solution_line_template: Mikaela spent {first_month_hours} + {additional_hours_second_month} = <<{first_month_hours}+{additional_hours_second_month}={second_month_hours}>>{second_month_hours} hours in the second month.
So, she tutored a total of {first_month_hours} + {second_month_hours} = <<{first_month_hours}+{second_month_hours}={total_tutoring_hours}>>{total_tutoring_hours} hours for the first two months.
Thus, her total earning was {total_tutoring_hours} x ${hourly_rate} = $<<{total_tutoring_hours}*{hourly_rate}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings}.
And, her total expenses was {expense_fraction} x ${total_earnings} = $<<{expense_fraction}*{total_earnings}={total_expenses}>>{total_expenses}.
Therefore, she saved an amount of ${total_earnings} - ${total_expenses} = $<<{total_earnings}-{total_expenses}={amount_saved}>>{amount_saved}.
